common.cleartext: A non-empty string indicates that the file is in clear text (not encoded).
common.version: ACE Direct Version number for display only.
common.year: The Copyright year for display only.
common.debug_level: Logging level: ALL TRACE DEBUG INFO WARN ERROR FATAL OFF

https.certificate: Full path to the certificate file
https.private_key: Full path to the private key file
https.csr: full path to asterisk csr file, for signaling server demo page web server

main.fqdn: Fully qualified domain name of this primary Node application server
main.private_ip: Private IP address of this primary Node application server

nginx.fqdn: Fully qualified domain name of the NGINX server
nginx.private_ip: Private IP address of the NGINX server

asterisk.fqdn: Fully qualified domain name of the Asterisk server
asterisk.private_ip: Private IP address of the Asterisk server

stun.fqdn: Fully qualified domain name of the stun server

turn.fqdn: Fully qualified domain name of turn server

kurento.fqdn: fully-qualified domain name of internal kurento media server, must point to private IP address

mysql.fqdn: Private IP address of the local ACE Direct MySQL server OR AWS RDS FQDN

redis.fqdn: Local IP address of the Redis server on acenode.domain.com: 127.0.0.1

mongodb.fqdn: Mongo DB host; leave blank to disable logging

zendesk.fqdn: fully-qualified domain name of commercial Zendesk server or private IP address of local Fendesk server

signaling_server.path: This is the acedirect-kurento route in /etc/nginx/nginx.conf on the portal.domain.com server

media_server.privacy_video_url: file location of privacy video file on the Kurento media server

sip.turn_port: string; port number of turn server; may be empty

ami.id: Asterisk AMI userid; retrieve from /etc/asterisk/manager.conf on acesip.domain.com
ami.passwd: Asterisk AMI password; retrieve from /etc/asterisk/manager.conf on acesip.domain.com

extensions.start_number: First consumer extension; see 'password=' in /etc/asterisk/pjsip.conf on acesip.domain.com
extensions.end_number: Last consumer extension; see 'password=' in /etc/asterisk/pjsip.conf on acesip.domain.com
extensions.secret: Consumer extension password; see 'password=' in /etc/asterisk/pjsip.conf on acesip.domain.com

complaint.number: Asterisk dial-in number for the complaint queue; from /etc/asterisk/extensions.conf on acesip.domain.com
complaint.name: string; name of complaint queue

general.number: Asterisk dial-in number for the general queue; from /etc/asterisk/extensions.conf on acesip.domain.com
general.name: string; name of general queue

videomail.number: Asterisk dial-in number for the videomail queue; from /etc/asterisk/extensions.conf on acesip.domain.com
videomail.name: string; name of videomail queue

videomail.max_record_secs: Maximum time (seconds) for a video mail
videomail.outbound_timeout_secs: Integer; maximum seconds to wait for outbound videomail server to respond

missed_calls.max_missed_calls: Number of consecutive missed calls before forcing the agent to Away status

json_web_token.encoding: Encoding scheme for the JSON web token
json_web_token.secret_key: Unique string key for the JSON web token

session.secret_key: Unique string key for the session

mysql.port: Port number for the ACE Direct MySQL server
mysql.user: Username for the ACE Direct MySQL user
mysql.password: Password for the ACE Direct MySQL user; value for _ACEDIRECT_PASSWORD_ in MySQL configuration
mysql.ssuser: (for signaling server) signaling server db user
mysql.sspassword: (for signaling server) signaling server db password; value for _MEDIASERVER_PASSWORD_ in MySQL configuration
mysql.ssdatabase: (for signaling server) signaling server db name

redis.auth: Redis authentication string; your chosen password for myRedisPassword during Redis installation

webrtcstats.logWebRTCStats: true/false boolean; turn on webrtc in-call stats for the agent portal (FPS and dropped packets indicators)
webrtcstats.logWebRTCStatsFreq: string; webrtc stats polling frequency (milliseconds); set to >= 1000, since the call stats object is quite large
webrtcstats.logWebRTCMongo: mongodb connection URI; leave empty to disable MongoDB logging

complaint_redirect.active: Complaint portal redirect? true or false
complaint_redirect.url: full HTTPS URL of website to redirect too at end of consumer web call

popticket.url: URL of zendesk pop ticket; omit this field to skip zendesk pop; this if for automatically populating a Zendesk ticket, assuming a Zendesk integration server is available.

skinny_mode.agent: Enable skinny mode for agent portal: true or false; true shows all web page dialogs
skinny_mode.consumer: Enable skinny mode for consumer portal: true or false; true shows all web page dialogs

caption_mode.agent: Enable captions for the agent portal
caption_mode.consumer: Enable captions for the consumer portal

nginx.ad_path: customizable NGINX path for agent/consumer portals
nginx.mp_path: customizable NGINX path for management portal
nginx.agent_route: customizable route for agent portal url
nginx.consumer_route: customizable route for consumer portal url

openam.path: OpenAM web path as specified in the OpenAM installation
openam.user: openAM admin user name from the OpenAM installation
openam.password: openAM admin password from the OpenAM installation

ace_direct.https_listen_port: Port that the ACE Direct portal listens on; must match value in nginx.conf on the NGINX server

management_portal.https_listen_port: Port that the Management Portal listens on; must match value in nginx.conf on the NGINX server
management_portal.poll_interval: Poll frequency (seconds) of the Management Portal statistics
management_portal.force_logout_password: a really secure password for the remote force agent logout feature

zendesk.port: Port number of the zendesk/fendesk server
zendesk.protocol: Use http for zendesk, https for fendesk
zendesk.user_id: email address of the zendesk user; this is a placeholder value for a real Zendesk account if available
zendesk.token: token of the zendesk user; this is a placeholder value for a real Zendesk account if available

acr_cdr.https_listen_port: Port that the ACR CDR portal listens on

user_service.port: Port number of the USERVER server
user_service.itrs_mode: Use ITRS to verify numbers? true|false

agent_service.port: Port number of the ASERVER server

agent_chat.save_agent_chats: boolean string (true/false) that enables or disables saving the agent chats to MongoDB

agent_incall_audio.mute_all_audio: boolean string (true/false) that enables or disables muting the agent audio at the beginning of a call

busylight.enabled: boolean string (true/false) that enables or disables the busylight in ACE Direct
busylight.awayBlink: boolean string (true/false) that enables blinking while Away, if callers are in queue

translation_server.port: Port number of the translation server

webserver.comment1: this is part of the signaling server configuration
webserver.port: Integer; port number of signaling server web server ace-direct/acedirect-kurento

asteriskss.comment1: this is part of the signaling server configuration

kurento.comment1: this is part of the signaling server configuration
kurento._comment2: Dev Notes, unused: 42001F fixes some problems. 42E015 - try this too - RFC3984 - page 38
kurento._comment3: Dev Notes, unused: WV tried 42e01f - did not work

videomailss.comment1: this is part of the signaling server configuration

filesharing.virus_scan_enabled: Virus scan will be enabled if set to 'true' but clamdscan must be set up on the machine for it to work. The default is false
